intro: Eschscholzia floribunda var. gracillima, commonly known as the slender poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange-red. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces slender, erect stems. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppy species.
